newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Office Depot soars.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Office Depot soars.

text.p: Shares in Office Depot Inc soared ahead of Wednesday's market open immediately after the retailer announced a merger agreement with Staples Inc.

"Office Depot is getting taken over by Staples in a stock deal that values it at about 22-1/4, and the stock is now trading at 20-1/2, while Staples -- which you would expect to sell off on the news -- is off 1/2, to 19," said a pre-open trader.
Office Depot finished Tuesday's New York Stock Exchange regular session at 15-3/4.
The companies said the merger is intended to be a tax-free swap of shares under which Office Depot holders will get 1.14 shares of Staples common for each outstanding share they own.
The merger will be accounted for as a pooling of interests and is subject to certain conditions, including shareholder approval and required regulatory approvals, they said.
Shares in Chateau Properties Inc are expected to gain at Wednesday's market open on news Manufactured Home Communities Inc has begun a $26 per share hostile tender offer for the company.
Ahead of the market open, Chateau shares were bid at 26-1/4, and offered as high as 27. The stock finished Tuesday New York Stock Exchange trade at 26-1/6.
Elsewhere, traders said they saw no moves in Digital Equipment Corp but expect the stock to be pressured in the regular session by a negative forecast last night.
DEC's chief financial officer said the first quarter order rate is weaker than the company previously expected, but declined to say whether or not DEC would report a loss.
